comments:
I did something wrong, and I would like to clarify what it was :)

I had two instances of Eclipse running on different workspaces, from the same
install - so a shared configuration directory.  In one of them, I did the following:

  1. Installed some plugins using the update manager
  2. Restarted a bunch of times, once using -clean

The other eclipse instance is now completely hosed.  Here are some of the
errors.  Was the problem that I did -clean, or was it just from installing some
plugins?

Lots of other errors followed these.
Have you been running two eclipse simultaneously from the same install?

"I had two instances of Eclipse running on different workspaces, from the same
install" -- So, yes. :)

This bug happened on I20041124 and two instances where running.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 79607 ***
